name: Interface PrimitiveIterator.OfLong
text: An Iterator specialized for long values.
codes:
public static interface PrimitiveIterator.OfLong
extends PrimitiveIterator<Long, LongConsumer>

methods.description: Returns the next long element in the iteration.

Performs the given action for each remaining element until all elements
 have been processed or the action throws an exception.  Actions are
 performed in the order of iteration, if that order is specified.
 Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the caller.
Returns the next element in the iteration.

methods.method_sig: default void forEachRemaining (Consumer<? super Long> action)
methods.description:
Performs the given action for each remaining element until all elements
 have been processed or the action throws an exception.  Actions are
 performed in the order of iteration, if that order is specified.
 Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the caller.
 
 The behavior of an iterator is unspecified if the action modifies the
 collection in any way (even by calling the remove method
 or other mutator methods of Iterator subtypes),
 unless an overriding class has specified a concurrent modification policy.
 
 Subsequent behavior of an iterator is unspecified if the action throws an
 exception.
